titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Amelia Stinson-Wesley papers, 1924-2004 RL.11711
titlestmt.author: Michelle Runyon and Megan Lewis

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-23 08:54:04 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Amelia Stinson-Wesley is an ordained Methodist minister and advocate for pastoral care of women and abuse survivors in North Carolina. Her papers consist of correspondence, academic writing, periodical excerpts, pamphlets, flyers, and handouts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Folders 23 and 24 in Box 2 are restricted until 25 years after the creator's death.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Amelia Stinson-Wesley papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Amelia Stinson-Wesley is an ordained Methodist minister and advocate for women's rights. She attended Meredith College in Raleigh for her undergraduate education from 1986-1990 and Duke Divinity School for her Masters of Divinity from 1990-1993. Stinson-Wesley served as the director of Response, part of the Resource Center for Women and Ministry in the South, and has in other roles advocated for women and victims of physical/sexual abuse.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Amelia Stinson-Wesley papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2018-0165

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Amelia Stinson-Wesley is an ordained Methodist minister and advocate for pastoral care of women and abuse survivors. Her papers consist of correspondence, academic writing, periodical excerpts, pamphlets, flyers, and handouts.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

controlaccess.corpname: Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture

did.unittitle: Women's Health and Violence Against Women

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to Stinson-Wesley's work related to women's health advocacy and violence against women. It contains research and resources related to those topics.

did.unittitle: Clergy Misconduct - Sexual Abuse Statistics and Articles
Denominational Resources on Violence Against Women
Fellowship of Reconciliation Stop the Violence Campaign

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes issues of Standing Together: A Publication of Rape Crisis of Durham

did.unittitle: Sexual Assault Support Services - Safe Haven

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents Amelia Stinson-Wesley's ministerial work, including pastoral care and advocacy. The materials consist of periodical clippings, personal writtings, flyers, handouts, and administrative records.
